title: Matteo Manente
text:
I am a Licensed Psychologist and a PhD Candidate in Psychological Sciences at the University of Padova.
I am also a member of the Psicostat research group, where we try to make sense of psychological data.
My work sits at the intersection of clinical psychology and quantitative methodology.
Currently, I am working on the development and application of Inferential Multiverse Meta-analysis. My goal is to investigate the robustness of the efficacy of psychotherapies, moving beyond simple effect sizes to understand how analytical choices shape scientific conclusions.

title: Matteo Manente
text:
I am a Licensed Psychologist and a PhD Candidate in Psychological Sciences at the University of Padova.
I am also a member of the Psicostat research group, where we try to make sense of psychological data.
My work sits at the intersection of clinical psychology and quantitative methodology.
Currently, I am working on the development and application of Inferential Multiverse Meta-analysis. My goal is to investigate the robustness of the efficacy of psychotherapies, moving beyond simple effect sizes to understand how analytical choices shape scientific conclusions.

title: Matteo Manente
text:
Research Interests


Statistics: Meta-analysis, Multiverse analysis, Permutation-based Inferential methods
Clinical Psychology: Psychotherapy efficacy, Clinical trial methodology
Open Science: Research Replicability, Philosophy of Science

title: Research
text:
Talks, Posters & Presentations

2026


Manente, M., Altoè, G., Finos, L., & Gambarota, F. (accepted). Your meta-analysis depends on choices: A multiverse approach to solid inference. Talk at the Cognitive Science Arena (CSA), Bressanone, Italy.
Manente, M., Finos, L., & Altoè, G. (submitted). Does EMDR Really Work? A Multiverse Meta-Analysis of PTSD Treatment Efficacy. Poster at the Italian Reproducibility Network (ITRN) Meeting, Verona, Italy.
Manente, M. (2026). Multiverse Meta-Analysis: Assessing Robustness and Researcher Degrees of Freedom in Psychological Research. Invited Talk for the Methodenvertiefung Meta-Analysis Course, University of Innsbruck.




2025


Manente, M., Gambarota, F., Finos, L., Vesely, A., & Altoè, G. (2025). Choices Shape Conclusions: An Inferential Multiverse approach to Meta-Analysis. Talk at the Psicostat Meeting (Online).
Sità, L., Manente, M., Perugini, A., Calignano, G., Toffalini, E., Marci, T., Pastore, M., & Altoè, G. (2025). Set up for a Methodological Review Board in Psychology. Symposium at the Platform for Young Meta-Scientists (PYMS), Tilburg, Netherlands.
Manente, M., Gambarota, F., Finos, L., Vesely, A., & Altoè, G. (2025). Enhancing Transparency and Rigor in Psychology: A Multiverse Inference Framework. Poster at the Associazione Italiana di Psicologia (AIP) Sperimentale National Congress, Torino, Italy.
Manente, M., Gambarota, F., Finos, L., Vesely, A., & Altoè, G. (2025). Post-Selection Inference in Multiverse Meta-Analysis (PIMMA). Talk at the European Mathematical Psychology Group (EMPG) Meeting, Padova, Italy.
